content.description: Sit start variation to Morning Routine but never touching the left side of the flake and instead using some of the holds around the corner on the east face of the boulder. Once standing on top of the flake, mantle over same as Morning Routine
content.location: Far right side of the main (south) face of the boulder

content.description: Just left of the middle on the tooth boulder. Start with a high left foot on a bad smeary pebble, left hand in bottom of the flake, right hand on the crimp. Move hand over hand on the left seam of the flake and move your right foot up very high just under the flake. Stand up tall, grab the right high crimp and go for the rim. Fun climb
Start with two hands on the ledge and feet below. Swing the left foot up onto the ledge and mantle up on top of it using a tiny side pull with your left hand. Then climb up the easy slab to top out.
content.location: Southwest corner of the Tooth boulder on the obvious four inch ledge

content.description: Climb up the jugs on the flake on the right side of the main face until you're standing on top of it. Then mantle up and over to top out.
content.protection: One or two pads and a spotter, but easy enough that none of it is really necessary
content.location: On the tooth boulder (all the way in the north of the park close to the river on the Cabin trail), go up the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Located deep in Minaus is a medium sized boulder which resembles a tooth with several decent variations on it.
